wikipedia_page.main: Kris John Ife (16 June 1946 – 8 November 2013) was an English singer and songwriter, who enjoyed modest success in Britain in the 1960s and 1970s. He recorded a version of "Hush", later covered by Deep Purple.

response: In 1969, his creative freedom restricted by drastic changes in A&R policy, Wirtz resigned his post at EMI Records to return to independent production. Associations with Larry Page's Penny Farthing label, Samantha Jones, and Kris Ife followed, during which Wirtz formed a co-writing partnership ("Learning 2 Live With Love", MWET/Spyderbaby (2005); "One Night Stand", MWET/Anthony Rivers (2005), and the Cooking For Cannibals soundtrack album (2007).
* British singer Kris Ife released a version in December 1967 (MGM Records single)

During 2004–6, Groome and Stride collaborated with A Teenage Opera composer Mark Wirtz on Love Is Eggshaped, and Micky and Rob wrote and performed on their Spyderbaby album, with contributions from Tony Rivers and Kris Ife.

Derrick, J. Vincent Edwards and Kris Ife began writing songs under the collective pseudonym Miki Antony,[ Ife biography @ Allmusic.com by Richie Unterberger] including "I Remember Natalie" recorded in 1968 by Bob Monkhouse (and arranged and co-produced by Mark Wirtz). "I Remember Natalie", SecondhandSongs.com. Retrieved 24 June 2014  Derrick then changed his name by deed poll to Miki Antony, and began writing and performing in his own right.
*Kris Ife, 67, English pop singer, heart attack.British Singer-Songwriter Kris Ife Dies

Later Edwards turned to song writing. With Pierre Tubbs he wrote "Right Back Where We Started From", which was a No. 8 hit in the UK Singles Chart for Maxine Nightingale in November 1975, and a No. 2 hit in the US in May 1976.Jonathon Jackson The Making of Slap Shot 2010 "The centerpiece of the soundtrack would be a song called “Right Back Where We Started From,” which had peaked at No. 2 on the pop chart in May 1976. Maxine Nightingale was a singer-actor from London who had made a name in her homeland by appearing in the rock musicals Hair, ... It was in Hair that she met a fellow performer named Vincent Edwards. In 1975, Edwards established a partnership with Pierre Tubbs, a writer and producer with United Artists Records" In addition, Edwards wrote songs with Miki Antony and Kris Ife.

* 1978 Yankee Doodle Disco (40 All-American Greats) by Liberty Belle (Produced by Kris Ife; arranged by Dave Rowberry/Wilf Gibson; engineered by Phil Harding; sax/flute/piccolo by Gary Barnacle; trumpet by Luke Tunney; trombone by Annie Whitehead) (album)
* 1982 "Do It Cos You Like It" by Justin Fashanu (Prod. by Kris Ife) (Brass:- Gary Barnacle/Luke Tunney/Annie Whitehead) (single)
